intro: Sinapis patens, commonly known as the slender mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring smooth, linear leaves and bright yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are small and capsule-like, containing a high amount of glucosinolates, which are chemical compounds responsible for the plant's characteristic pungent odor. Sinapis patens is often found in disturbed soils and can be a weed in agricultural fields.
